trans-unit.source: Pre-process and Clean Data | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Pre-process and Clean Data | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Pre-process and Clean Data
trans-unit.target: Pre-process and Clean Data

trans-unit.source: Pre-processing and cleaning data are important tasks that typically must be conducted before using a dataset effectively for machine learning.
trans-unit.target: Pre-processing and cleaning data are important tasks that typically must be conducted before using a dataset effectively for machine learning.

trans-unit.source: This task is part of the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology (ADAPT) provided by Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: This task is part of the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology (ADAPT) provided by Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: Raw data is often noisy and unreliable, and may be missing values.
trans-unit.target: Raw data is often noisy and unreliable, and may be missing values.

trans-unit.source: Using such data for modeling can produce misleading results.
trans-unit.target: Using such data for modeling can produce misleading results.

trans-unit.source: This article introduces various data processing concepts and tasks that can be taken before ingesting data into Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: This article introduces various data processing concepts and tasks that can be taken before ingesting data into Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: For more detailed instructions on this process, see the <linkText>Learning Guide: Advanced data processing in Azure</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more detailed instructions on this process, see the <linkText>Learning Guide: Advanced data processing in Azure</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Real world data is gathered from various sources and processes and it may contain irregularities or corrupt data compromising the quality of the dataset.
trans-unit.target: Real world data is gathered from various sources and processes and it may contain irregularities or corrupt data compromising the quality of the dataset.

trans-unit.source: The typical data quality issues that arise are:
trans-unit.target: The typical data quality issues that arise are:

trans-unit.source: Incomplete: Data lacks attributes or containing missing values.
trans-unit.target: Incomplete: Data lacks attributes or containing missing values.

trans-unit.source: Noisy: Data contains erroneous records or outliers.
trans-unit.target: Noisy: Data contains erroneous records or outliers.

trans-unit.source: Inconsistent: Data contains conflicting records or discrepancies.
trans-unit.target: Inconsistent: Data contains conflicting records or discrepancies.

trans-unit.source: Quality data is a prerequisite for quality predictive models.
trans-unit.target: Quality data is a prerequisite for quality predictive models.

trans-unit.source: To avoid "garbage in, garbage out" and improve data quality and therefore model performance, it is imperative to conduct a data health screen to spot data issues early and decide on the corresponding data processing and cleaning steps.
trans-unit.target: To avoid "garbage in, garbage out" and improve data quality and therefore model performance, it is imperative to conduct a data health screen to spot data issues early and decide on the corresponding data processing and cleaning steps.

trans-unit.source: We can check the general quality of data by checking:
trans-unit.target: We can check the general quality of data by checking:

trans-unit.source: The number of records.
trans-unit.target: The number of records.

trans-unit.source: The number of attributes (or features).
trans-unit.target: The number of attributes (or features).

trans-unit.source: The attribute data types (nominal, ordinal, or continuous).
trans-unit.target: The attribute data types (nominal, ordinal, or continuous).

trans-unit.source: The number of missing values.
trans-unit.target: The number of missing values.

trans-unit.source: Well-formedness of the data.
trans-unit.target: Well-formedness of the data.

trans-unit.source: If the data is in tsv or csv, questions whether the column separators and line separators always correctly separate columns and lines.
trans-unit.target: If the data is in tsv or csv, questions whether the column separators and line separators always correctly separate columns and lines.

trans-unit.source: If the data is in HTML or XML format, check whether the data is well formed based on the respective standards.
trans-unit.target: If the data is in HTML or XML format, check whether the data is well formed based on the respective standards.

trans-unit.source: Parsing may also be necessary in order to extract structured information from semi-structured or unstructured data.
trans-unit.target: Parsing may also be necessary in order to extract structured information from semi-structured or unstructured data.

trans-unit.source: Inconsistent data records.
trans-unit.target: Inconsistent data records.

trans-unit.source: e.g. If the data contains student GPA, check if the GPA is in the designated range, say 0~4.
trans-unit.target: e.g. If the data contains student GPA, check if the GPA is in the designated range, say 0~4.

trans-unit.source: When you find issues with data, processing steps are necessary which often involves cleaning missing values, data normalization, discretization, text processing to remove and/or replace embedded characters which may affect data alignment, mixed data types in common fields, and others.
trans-unit.target: When you find issues with data, processing steps are necessary which often involves cleaning missing values, data normalization, discretization, text processing to remove and/or replace embedded characters which may affect data alignment, mixed data types in common fields, and others.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning consumes well-formed tabular data.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning consumes well-formed tabular data.

trans-unit.source: If the data is already in tabular form, data pre-processing can be performed directly with Azure Machine Learning in the ML Studio.
trans-unit.target: If the data is already in tabular form, data pre-processing can be performed directly with Azure Machine Learning in the ML Studio.

trans-unit.source: If data is not in tabular form, say XML, parsing may be required in order to convert the data to tabular form.
trans-unit.target: If data is not in tabular form, say XML, parsing may be required in order to convert the data to tabular form.

trans-unit.source: Data cleaning: Fill in or missing values, detect and remove noisy data and outliers.
trans-unit.target: Data cleaning: Fill in or missing values, detect and remove noisy data and outliers.

trans-unit.source: Data transformation: Normalize data to reduce dimensions and noise.
trans-unit.target: Data transformation: Normalize data to reduce dimensions and noise.

trans-unit.source: Data reduction: Sample data records or attributes for easier data handling.
trans-unit.target: Data reduction: Sample data records or attributes for easier data handling.

trans-unit.source: Data discretization: Convert continuous attributes to categorical attributes for ease of use with certain machine learning methods.
trans-unit.target: Data discretization: Convert continuous attributes to categorical attributes for ease of use with certain machine learning methods.

trans-unit.source: Text cleaning: remove embedded characters which may cause data misalignment, for e.g., embedded tabs in a tab-separated data file, embedded new lines which may break records, etc.
trans-unit.target: Text cleaning: remove embedded characters which may cause data misalignment, for e.g., embedded tabs in a tab-separated data file, embedded new lines which may break records, etc.

trans-unit.source: The sections below detail some of these data processing steps.
trans-unit.target: The sections below detail some of these data processing steps.

trans-unit.source: To deal with missing values, it is best to first identify the reason for the missing values to better handle the problem.
trans-unit.target: To deal with missing values, it is best to first identify the reason for the missing values to better handle the problem.

trans-unit.source: Typical missing value handling methods are:
trans-unit.target: Typical missing value handling methods are:

trans-unit.source: Deletion: Remove records with missing values
trans-unit.target: Deletion: Remove records with missing values

trans-unit.source: Dummy substitution: Replace missing values with a dummy value: e.g, unknown for categorical or 0 for numerical values.
trans-unit.target: Dummy substitution: Replace missing values with a dummy value: e.g, unknown for categorical or 0 for numerical values.

trans-unit.source: Mean substitution: If the missing data is numerical, replace the missing values with the mean.
trans-unit.target: Mean substitution: If the missing data is numerical, replace the missing values with the mean.

trans-unit.source: Frequent substitution: If the missing data is categorical, replace the missing values with the most frequent item
trans-unit.target: Frequent substitution: If the missing data is categorical, replace the missing values with the most frequent item

trans-unit.source: Regression substitution: Use a regression method to replace missing values with regressed values.
trans-unit.target: Regression substitution: Use a regression method to replace missing values with regressed values.

trans-unit.source: Data normalization re-scales numerical values to a specified range.
trans-unit.target: Data normalization re-scales numerical values to a specified range.

trans-unit.source: Popular data normalization methods include:
trans-unit.target: Popular data normalization methods include:

trans-unit.source: Min-Max Normalization: Linearly transform the data to a range, say between 0 and 1, where the min value is scaled to 0 and max value to 1.
trans-unit.target: Min-Max Normalization: Linearly transform the data to a range, say between 0 and 1, where the min value is scaled to 0 and max value to 1.

trans-unit.source: Z-score Normalization: Scale data based on mean and standard deviation: divide the difference between the data and the mean by the standard deviation.
trans-unit.target: Z-score Normalization: Scale data based on mean and standard deviation: divide the difference between the data and the mean by the standard deviation.

trans-unit.source: Decimal scaling: Scale the data by moving the decimal point of the attribute value.
trans-unit.target: Decimal scaling: Scale the data by moving the decimal point of the attribute value.

trans-unit.source: Data can be discretized by converting continuous values to nominal attributes or intervals.
trans-unit.target: Data can be discretized by converting continuous values to nominal attributes or intervals.

trans-unit.source: Some ways of doing this are:
trans-unit.target: Some ways of doing this are:

trans-unit.source: Equal-Width Binning: Divide the range of all possible values of an attribute into N groups of the same size, and assign the values that fall in a bin with the bin number.
trans-unit.target: Equal-Width Binning: Divide the range of all possible values of an attribute into N groups of the same size, and assign the values that fall in a bin with the bin number.

trans-unit.source: Equal-Height Binning: Divide the range of all possible values of an attribute into N groups, each containing the same number of instances, then assign the values that fall in a bin with the bin number.
trans-unit.target: Equal-Height Binning: Divide the range of all possible values of an attribute into N groups, each containing the same number of instances, then assign the values that fall in a bin with the bin number.

trans-unit.source: There are various methods to reduce data size for easier data handling.
trans-unit.target: There are various methods to reduce data size for easier data handling.

trans-unit.source: Depending on data size and the domain, the following methods can be applied:
trans-unit.target: Depending on data size and the domain, the following methods can be applied:

trans-unit.source: Record Sampling: Sample the data records and only choose the representative subset from the data.
trans-unit.target: Record Sampling: Sample the data records and only choose the representative subset from the data.

trans-unit.source: Attribute Sampling: Select only a subset of the most important attributes from the data.
trans-unit.target: Attribute Sampling: Select only a subset of the most important attributes from the data.

trans-unit.source: Aggregation: Divide the data into groups and store the numbers for each group.
trans-unit.target: Aggregation: Divide the data into groups and store the numbers for each group.

trans-unit.source: For example, the daily revenue numbers of a restaurant chain over the past 20 years can be aggregated to monthly revenue to reduce the size of the data.
trans-unit.target: For example, the daily revenue numbers of a restaurant chain over the past 20 years can be aggregated to monthly revenue to reduce the size of the data.

trans-unit.source: Text fields in tabular data may include characters which affect columns alignment and/or record boundaries.
trans-unit.target: Text fields in tabular data may include characters which affect columns alignment and/or record boundaries.

trans-unit.source: For e.g., embedded tabs in a tab-separated file cause column misalignment, and embedded new line characters break record lines.
trans-unit.target: For e.g., embedded tabs in a tab-separated file cause column misalignment, and embedded new line characters break record lines.

trans-unit.source: Improper text encoding handling while writing/reading text leads to information loss, inadvertent introduction of unreadable characters, e.g., nulls, and may also affect text parsing.
trans-unit.target: Improper text encoding handling while writing/reading text leads to information loss, inadvertent introduction of unreadable characters, e.g., nulls, and may also affect text parsing.

trans-unit.source: Careful parsing and editing may be required in order to clean text fields for proper alignment and/or to extract structured data from unstructured or semi-structured text data.
trans-unit.target: Careful parsing and editing may be required in order to clean text fields for proper alignment and/or to extract structured data from unstructured or semi-structured text data.

trans-unit.source: Data exploration offers an early view into the data.
trans-unit.target: Data exploration offers an early view into the data.

trans-unit.source: A number of data issues can be uncovered during this step and corresponding methods can be applied to address those issues.
trans-unit.target: A number of data issues can be uncovered during this step and corresponding methods can be applied to address those issues.

trans-unit.source: It is important to ask questions such as what is the source of the issue and how the issue may have been introduced.
trans-unit.target: It is important to ask questions such as what is the source of the issue and how the issue may have been introduced.

trans-unit.source: This also helps you decide on the data processing steps that need to be taken to resolve them.
trans-unit.target: This also helps you decide on the data processing steps that need to be taken to resolve them.

trans-unit.source: The kind of insights one intends to derive from the data can also be used to prioritize the data processing effort.
trans-unit.target: The kind of insights one intends to derive from the data can also be used to prioritize the data processing effort.

trans-unit.source: Data Mining: Concepts and Techniques, Third Edition, Morgan Kaufmann, 2011, Jiawei Han, Micheline Kamber, and Jian Pei
trans-unit.target: Data Mining: Concepts and Techniques, Third Edition, Morgan Kaufmann, 2011, Jiawei Han, Micheline Kamber, and Jian Pei
